text: Morgana King (June 4, 1930 - March 22, 2018) was an American jazz singer and actress.Liner notes by Joel Dorn – Morgana King album The Complete Reprise Recordings (2000).Liner notes by Ed Osborne – Morgana King re-issue album It's A Quite Thing (2006).Beverly Kenny Sings For Johnny Smith. Toshiba EMI Japan 1955 song "Moe's Blues", track listing 11. Her best known role was that of Carmela Corleone in The Godfather (1972) and The Godfather Part II (1974).Nichols, Peter M. The New York Times Guide to the Best 1000 Movies Ever Made (2004), p. 390; Maltin, Leonard Leonard Maltin's 2009 Movie Guide (2008), p. 530; King was born in Pleasantville, New York. She was raised in New York City. King died, aged 87, of non-Hodgkin lymphoma in Palm Springs, California, on March 22, 2018."Morgana King, jazz singer who played Brando’s wife in ‘The Godfather,’ dies at 87", by Matt Schudell, The Washington Post ==References== ==Other websites== * Morgana King at Verve Records * * Morgana King at Billboard.com * Morgana King at Last.fm Category:1930 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from non-Hodgkin lymphoma Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American jazz musicians Category:American blues musicians Category:American pop singers Category:Actors from New York City Category:Singers from New York City Category:Musicians from New York City
title: Morgana King
